# Cleaning the Austin House Data

```{r}

library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
austinhouse = read.csv("/Users/evanschwartz/664Project/Data/austinHousingData.csv")
austinhouse2 = select(austinhouse, -3, -5,-24, -25, -26, -32, -33 , -47) #removes desired columns
austinhouse3 = filter(austinhouse2, homeType == "Single Family") #filters to only single family homes
austinhouse3


```

# Merging The Economic data 

```{r}
weekly <- read.csv("/Users/evanschwartz/Downloads/fredgraph/Weekly_Ending_Thursday.csv")
monthly <- read.csv("/Users/evanschwartz/Downloads/fredgraph/Monthly.csv")
annual <- read.csv("/Users/evanschwartz/Downloads/fredgraph/Annual.csv")

# We make the choice to copy one annual data point from 2020 to 2021 given that only a small number of sales occur in 2021 
annual[4,5] = annual[3,5]


start_date <-as.Date("2018-01-22")
end_date <- as.Date("2021-01-30")

expand_to_daily <- function(data, start_date, end_date) {
  data %>%
    
    mutate(DATE = as.Date(DATE)) %>%
    # 
    complete(DATE = seq(start_date, end_date, by = "day")) %>%
    # 
    fill(value, .direction = "down")
}


daily_weekly <- expand_to_daily(weekly, start_date, end_date)
daily_monthly <- expand_to_daily(monthly, start_date, end_date)
daily_annual <- expand_to_daily(annual, start_date, end_date)

```
